title: Best Ever Lemon Drizzle Cake Recipe
description: This lemon drizzle cake recipe is super easy to make in a loaf pan. A delicious lemon glaze is drizzled over the warm cake for an extra kick of lemon.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Lemon Cake Recipes Best Ever Lemon Drizzle Cake 4.4 (9) 7 Reviews 3 Photos This lemon drizzle cake recipe is one of my favorite cakes to make when it's warm and sunny outside. Nothing says sunshine like bright yellow, zesty lemons. When life gives you lemons, make lemon cake! Submitted by Try This Recipe! Updated on March 4, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 loaf cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 cup white sugar 1 cup unsalted butter, slightly softened 4 large eggs 1 ¾ cups self-rising flour 1 teaspoon baking powder (Optional) 1 medium lemon, zested Lemon Glaze: 1 medium lemon, zested and juiced 7 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a loaf pan with parchment paper. Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift in flour and baking powder gradually; fold with a wooden spoon to be sure flour is combined. Stir in lemon zest. Pour batter into the prepared pan, being careful not to press it down. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Try not to open the oven door early to avoid collapsing the fluffy cake. Meanwhile, make the lemon glaze: Juice the zested lemon from the cake batter into a small bowl. Add zest and juice of second lemon. Stir in sugar until dissolved; taste and add more sugar or lemon juice to suit your taste. Drizzle glaze over the warm cake and leave to cool in the pan; glaze will harden as the cake cools. Cook’s Note I use 4 to 5 tablespoons of lemon juice for the glaze. Add more sugar or lemon juice to suit your taste. You can add very finely chopped mint leaves to the glaze for a refreshing twist. I Made It Print 31 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 494 Calories 26g Fat 63g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 494 % Daily Value * Total Fat 26g 33% Saturated Fat 15g 77% Cholesterol 154mg 51% Sodium 569mg 25% Total Carbohydrate 63g 23% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 39g Protein 6g 13% Vitamin C 22mg 24% Calcium 231mg 18% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 116mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Best Ever Lemon Drizzle Cake 01 of 03 Photo by  Kim 02 of 03 Photo by  Kim 02/26/2024 Needs improvement Confusing directions I really really wanted to like this cake--but the drizzle part ruined it. The directions are bit confusing in that department--the recipe says to use 1/3 cup sugar, while the directions say 7 tbsps sugar. Regardless, if you juice 2 lemons, add the zest of one, and use 1/3 sugar-- the drizzle will be far too bitter/sour! I went ahead with it anyway, because I wanted to follow the recipe verbatim; and it made my cake extremely unpleasant. There needs to be an amount of lemon juice stated for the drizzle, not just "juice 2 lemons" (especially since lemon size can vary drastically). Another similar recipe uses 3/4 sugar to 1/3 cup lemon juice; and that seems to be a more correct ratio of lemon juice to sugar. The pieces of cake that I managed to try that didn't have the drizzle on them tasted ok; but it just didn't 'wow' me. The cake also needed over 1 hour to bake properly. Sorry to give a bad review, but this recipe just didn't work for me. Thanks for sharing your recipe! 03 of 03 Photo by  Try This Recipe! 10/24/2017 1 You’ll Also Love Lemon Drizzle Loaf Cake 3 Ratings Lemon Loaf Cake 24 Ratings Lemon Shortbread Cookies 2 Ratings Lemon Glazed Cake 176 Ratings Lemon Drizzle Cake 16 Ratings Lemon Polenta Biscuits 6 Ratings Lemon Blueberry Cake 26 Ratings Vegan Orange Cranberry Cookies Dolcetti di Marzapane (Italian Marzipan Cookies) Old-Fashioned Lemon Pound Cake 27 Ratings Simple Lemon Cake 102 Ratings Lemon Ricotta Cake 34 Ratings Limoncello Ricotta Cake 17 Ratings Lemon Ricotta Cookies with Lemon Glaze 35 Ratings Buttercream-Frosted Lemon Sugar Cookies Lemon Poppy Seed Cake 8 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Try This Recipe!
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a loaf pan with parchment paper.;Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift in flour and baking powder gradually; fold with a wooden spoon to be sure flour is combined. Stir in lemon zest.;Pour batter into the prepared pan, being careful not to press it down.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Try not to open the oven door early to avoid collapsing the fluffy cake.;Meanwhile, make the lemon glaze: Juice the zested lemon from the cake batter into a small bowl. Add zest and juice of second lemon. Stir in sugar until dissolved; taste and add more sugar or lemon juice to suit your taste.;Drizzle glaze over the warm cake and leave to cool in the pan; glaze will harden as the cake cools.
